summary:
This ENB Preset goal is to make skyrim more beautifull but staying playable (> 40 fps)
It uses ENB v 0.254 from Boris Vorontsov
http://www.enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0254.htm
descriptionHtml:
This ENB Preset goal is to make skyrim more beautifull but staying playable (> 40 fps)

It uses ENB v 0.254 from Boris Vorontsov [url=http://www.enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0254.htm]http://www.enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0254.htm[/url]

[i]It would be nice if you tell me wich version you prefer[/i]

[u][b]Last Changes:[/b][/u]
•This is the final release until a new version of enbseries is released by Boris. I have played with this preset from lvl 1 to 20 and visited skyrim without seeing any problems, everything looks as desired (exterior days, nights, sunsets, sunrises, caves, mines, burrow, dwemer ruins, citites ...)


•SSAO setup for those who wanted to activate it (about 5 fps lost)

[u][b]Description:[/b][/u]

•I wanted to create a preset which fullfill thoses goals:
•Staying above 40 fps in exteriors on my config (7850 + core i5@3.8ghz) despite heavy graphics mods (SFO, Texture Pack, ...)
•Natural lighing and shadows
•No pitch dark night
•NO DOF because DOF is very nice for screen shot but very unatural. In real life do you ever notice blured background? DOF simulate a camera effect not really the eyes and since i am playing in First person view, I don't like it.
[b]•Night vision is working[/b]

[u][b]Compatibility:[/b][/u]

•COT & Religting Skyrim: This preset was made and tuned using Climate of Tamriel + Weather Pacth and Relighting Skyrim
•May not looks fine with any other Lighting mod (RLO, ELFX, etc)
•May not looks fine with any other mod wich change the imagespace

[u][b]Install Step:[/b][/u]

1 - Download ENB binaries from http://www.enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0254.htm
2 - Unpack the files from wrapper version into your skyrim root directory (not data)
3 - Unpack the files from this preset into Skyrim root directory (not data). Overwrite any file if asked
4 - Setup you enblocal.ini
5 - Make sure that those lines are in your Skyrimprefs.ini :
[i][quote=ini]
[Display]
bFloatPointRenderTarget=1
bDrawLandShadows=1
bShadowsOnGrass=1

[Grass]
b30GrassVS=1
bGrassPointLighting=0 ; This parameter decreases the lignting quality of grass but improve performances a lot (about 8-10 fps more)
[/quote][/i]

6 - Deactivate game engine Anisotropic filtering and AntiAliasing and HDR blur. It's handled by the ENB
7 - Launch skyrim and enjoy
